Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the log, we see the user works on different documents and applications. Possible cases: - Working on a Word document (Document1.docx) - Working on an email (in Google Chrome, Email - Inbox) - Working on a PDF (Report_Draft.pdf) - Working on an Excel file (Budget_2024.xlsx) - Working on another Word document (Quarterly_Report.docx)

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: We can define a case by the document (or email) being worked on. For the email, we can consider the email thread as a case and use the window title as the case ID. I propose the following case IDs: - Case1: Document1.docx ... Case5: Quarterly_Report.docx

Name: Validation - IND
Text: However, note that the user returns to Document1.docx after working on Excel. So we can consider the two sessions on Document1.docx as part of the same case because it is the same document. We have to decide: do we want to split by session or merge by document?

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Rules: - For Microsoft Word, the case ID is the window title (the document name). - For Google Chrome with window title Email - Inbox, we use the email subject from the action when available. Here, we see Open Email about Annual Meeting, so we can use Annual Meeting as part of the case ID. - For Adobe Acrobat, the case ID is the window title (the PDF file name). - For Microsoft Excel, the case ID is the window title

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: For process mining, we are interested in the activities within a case. The SWITCH event might be noise. We can skip the SWITCH events and only consider the events that are directly about the case. Alternatively, we can map the SWITCH event to the case of the target application. Lets reconsider: We want to capture the process of working on a document. The SWITCH event marks the point where the user leaves one document and starts another. Given the time, lets stick to the original plan of ignoring SWITCH events

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: FOCUS: Open Document TYPING: Edit Content SAVE: Save Document CLOSE: Close Document CLICK (in email): Open Email, Reply to Email, Send Email SCROLL: Scroll Document HIGHLIGHT: Highlight Text

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Lets create the event log: Events: 1. 2024-12-11T08:59:50.000Z, Quarterly_Report.docx, Open Document ... We missed the FOCUS event at 09:07:15 for Quarterly_Report.docx. We should include it as Resume Document. Lets update the event log accordingly.
